alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Albany County through 630 PM MDT... At 547 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Bosler, or 24 miles northwest of Laramie, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock River and Bosler. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 285 and 305. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range
